record.dc:title: 26BT20, 15BT20, Butler County, Kentucky. Annis Village. Structure 1.
record.wpa:project_reservoir: Late Prehistoric Mississippian Sites in Kentucky
record.wpa:narrative: Wall outline of Structure 1, 18 by 20 feet in size. Stakes on pillars, 10' apart, later removed, were included in this picture to show relation to ground surface. Inside the left wall is a series of halved, excavated postmolds, apparently related to it. although these, and other postmolds (see plat), may represent a reconstruction of this dwelling, or even another later structure unrelated to structure 1. This view is supported by the presence of two fire basins, both shown here, the one complete, the other halved. View from south. See also photo 27.
